result.execSummary:
This case has not been concluded. Unless a judgment of conviction is entered, the defendant is presumed innocent of all charges.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.
result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Vanessa Ann Johnson

records.addlTxt:
Defendant Vanessa Ann Johnson not in court - Authorization filed. Attorney Bradley J. Lochowicz in court for Vanessa Ann Johnson.  Attorney J J. Crawford in court for State of Wisconsin. Called @ 4:03 p.m. Appearances made. Matter before the Court for 9th status on 20CT563, and  7th status on 22CM8. Record by Atty. Lochowicz who requests trial dates. State makes oral motion for joinder. No objection by Atty. Lochowicz. Court joins files and sets for trial.
Pre-trial conference scheduled for January 18, 2023 at 03:00 pm.
Jury trial - 12 person scheduled for January 23, 2023 at 08:30 am.
Status conference on September 15, 2022 at 03:00 pm.
EFFECTIVE DATE OF THIS ASSIGNMENT IS AUGUST 1, 2022.

Defendant Vanessa Ann Johnson not in court.  Attorney Keith Venema for  Bradley J. Lochowicz in court for Vanessa Ann Johnson. Prosecuting attorney Vivien L. TenHaken in court for the State of Wisconsin. Case to be reassigned and set for Status hearing in August. Minutes filed.

Defendant Vanessa Ann Johnson not in court.  Attorney Keith Venema for Bradley J. Lochowicz in court for Vanessa Ann Johnson. Prosecuting attorney Andrew Herrmann in court for the State of Wisconsin. Minutes filed. Minutes filed.
Status conference scheduled for July 15, 2022 at 08:30 am.
Invocation of Right to Counsel
Authorization to Appear and Act

Defendant Vanessa Ann Johnson not in court. Attorney Caleb Tomaszewski for Bradley J. Lochowicz in court for Vanessa Ann Johnson. Prosecuting attorney Vivien L. TenHaken in court for the State of Wisconsin. Defendant is in custody in Rock County. Trying to het into treatment court in Rock Co. Minutes filed.
Status conference scheduled for June 10, 2022 at 08:30 am.
Bradley Lochowicz
Signed bond filed with the court.

Prosecuting attorney J.J. Crawford in court for the State of Wisconsin.  Defendant Vanessa Ann Johnson in court, in custody by video.  Attorney Tony Kim in court for Vanessa Ann Johnson. Called at 1:25 PM. Record by Attorney Kim as to treatment information. State objects, record by State as to objections. Court grants motion and removes cash component from bond to allow her to enter treatment in Rock County. Future dates to remain as scheduled. Minutes filed.

BOND TOTAL ALL FILES:  22CM8, AND 20CT563.  
Defendant shall not possess or consume alcohol.  Defendant shall not drive a motor vehicle without a valid driver's license.  Defendant shall not possess or use illegal drugs or drug paraphernalia.  Defendant will not possess any firearms, ammunition or other weapons.   No controlled substances without a valid prescription.  Defendant shall personally ensure that payments are made under any Order for Income Withholding if the Court appoints an attorney for the defendant.
Scheduling Order will be provided to Attys via e-filing by the Court

Defendant Vanessa Ann Johnson in court.  Attorney Tony Kim in court for Vanessa Ann Johnson. Prosecuting attorney Vivien L. TenHaken in court for the State of Wisconsin.  Minutes filed.
Status conference scheduled for April 27, 2022 at 08:30 am.

Defendant Vanessa Ann Johnson appeared by video, in custody, Attorney Tony Kim by telephone for Vanessa Ann Johnson. Plaintiff State of Wisconsin appeared in court by Andrew Herrmann. Called @ 3:14 p.m. Appearances made. Matter before the Court for motion to modify bond on all files 22CM8, 20CT563, and 22GF161. Record by the State who moves to dismiss the GF file - granted. Further record by the State who will not object to lowering cash bond, but objects to the amount requested by Atty. Kim in his motion. Response/record by Atty. Kim as to bed available for the defendant to begin treatment in Rock County. Atty. Kim responds to questions of the Court regarding treatment program, restrictions, etc. Court will require more information before deciding bond motion and takes it under advisement.
Court addresses initial appearance on 22CM8. Atty. Kim has not gone over charges/penalties with the defendant. Court goes over charges and penalties with the defendant. Atty. Kimm enters not guilty plea on defendant's behalf.  Court sets both misdemeanors before Judge Johnson for status, but also sets matters before this court to address bond motion once Atty. Kim gets more information regarding treatment program in Rock County. Court in recess.
Motion hearing scheduled for March 24, 2022 at 01:15 pm.
Status conference scheduled for March 22, 2022 at 08:30 am.

Defendant Vanessa Ann Johnson appeared in custody, by video, Attorney Tony Kim for Vanessa Ann Johnson appeared in court, Plaintiff State of Wisconsin appeared in court by Andrew Herrmann. Called @ 3:00 p.m. Appearances made. Matter before the court for 2nd statuses on files 22CM8, 20CT563, and hearing on 22GF161. Record by Atty. Kim that he believes the state will not be charging the GF file at this time. Response by Atty. Herrmann that they are waiting for drug results to make charging decision. Response by the Court as to time it takes for results to come back. Response by the State. Further record by Atty. Kim as to bond motion that was filed earlier today. State requires 24 hour notice to address bond motions. Response by the Court who sets all matters to Thursday, March 17th to address bond motion and whether court will dismiss the GF as State is not charging at this time. Atty. Kim may appear by phone for the hearing. Court in recess.
Motion hearing scheduled for March 17, 2022 at 03:00 pm.
Status conference on March 15, 2022 at 03:00 pm.

Defendant Vanessa Ann Johnson appeared in court, in custody by video with Attorney Tony Kim. ADA Andrew Herrmann appears for the State of Wisconsin. Called @ 3:46 p.m. Appearances made. Matter before the Court for hearing on 22GF161 and 1st status on 22CM8 and 22CT563.  Record by Atty. Kim who needs more time to go over discovery as he was just appointed. Discussion as to pending referral. Court sets all matters over for potential bond motion and status on all files. Court in recess.
Motion on postconviction relief hearing scheduled for March 1, 2022 at 03:00 pm.
Signed bond filed with the court.

BOND TOTAL ALL FILES:  22GF161, 22CM8, AND 20CT563.  Defendant shall not possess or consume alcohol.  Defendant shall not drive a motor vehicle without a valid driver's license.  Defendant shall not possess or use illegal drugs or drug paraphernalia.  Defendant will not possess any firearms, ammunition or other weapons.   No controlled substances without a valid prescription.  Defendant shall personally ensure that payments are made under any Order for Income Withholding if the Court appoints an attorney for the defendant.

District Attorney, Zeke Wiedenfeld in Court. Defendant, Vanessa Ann Johnson in court, in custody, by video with Attorney Leah Selmek who appears for bond purposes only. Called @ 1:14 p.m. Appearances made. Matter before the Court for bond hearing on 22GF161, and return on warrants regarding 20CT563 and 22CM8. Record by the Court as to Risk Assessment. Response/record by the State as to criminal history of the defendant, pending charges out of Rock County, Missed appearances. State is asking for $10,000.00 cash bond with conditions. Atty. Selmek is not taking  a position on bond. Based upon risk assessment and record today, Court sets bond as requested by the State. State to have information filed by Thursday. All matters set before Judge Reddy as new case is drug charges.  Status conference scheduled for February 17, 2022 at 03:00 pm.
Original Warrant filed with the court.
Notice of Motion and Motion for Establishment of Discovery Deadlines.
